criteria: Ability to rewrite functions and identify key properties
Understanding and application of exponent properties
descriptions: Student cannot rewrite the function or identify any key properties.
Student attempts to rewrite the function but struggles to identify key properties.
Student can rewrite the function but has difficulty explaining the properties revealed.
Student can rewrite the function and identify some key properties, but struggles with complete explanations.
Student can rewrite the function and accurately explain most of the key properties revealed.
Student can rewrite the function, accurately explain all key properties revealed, and provide insightful observations.
Student shows no understanding of exponent properties.
Student shows limited understanding of exponent properties.
Student can apply basic exponent properties but struggles with more complex expressions.
Student can apply most exponent properties correctly but makes occasional errors.
Student demonstrates a strong understanding and application of exponent properties.
Student demonstrates a comprehensive understanding and skillful application of exponent properties in various contexts.
Student cannot interpret exponential function expressions.
Student attempts to interpret exponential function expressions but struggles with the concept.
Student can identify growth or decay but struggles with the percent rate of change.
Student can identify growth or decay and calculate the percent rate of change with some errors.
Student can accurately identify growth or decay and calculate the percent rate of change.
Student can accurately interpret exponential function expressions, calculate the percent rate of change, and classify them as growth or decay with detailed explanations.
